isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Turbochargers - Disassemble - Control Valve Replacement (EVRT®)

step1.para: Remove control valve retaining bolt, bracket, and solenoid. Have a shop towel and a container handy for draining oil.
Inspect valve and center housing bore for pieces of or missing O-rings.
Position new bracket on new control valve solenoid.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, make certain control valve has been seated by hand. Do not to draw the control valve into place with retaining bolt. When the control valve is seated correctly, a sharp "snap" will be heard and felt. If this "snap" is not felt or heard, remove control valve and inspect for damaged O-rings.

step1.para: Coat new control valve O-rings with clean engine oil and position on control valve solenoid. Push solenoid in turbocharger center housing until fully seated.
Install retaining bolt and tighten to the standard torque value of 31 N·m (23 lbf·ft).
